intro: Alismorkis emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water plantain, is a wetland plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in ponds, streams, and marshes. The plant has elongated, narrow leaves that are usually submerged or floating, with a distinctive waxy coating. Its small, white flowers bloom in clusters, often with three sepals and three petals. Alismorkis emarginata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
